info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 20 at 2:37PM PDT until April 21 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with higher amounts above 6000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...High terrain in Siskiyou County above 5000 feet, including Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar Road and Scott Mountain Summit on Highway 3. Some snow is possible down to Snowmans Summit on Highway 89 but snow accumulations should be limited to a few inches. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
